Source code for src.models.user

"""
Handle everything related to the User model
Define the User model.
Define the User schema.
Define the User crud.
Export the User model.
"""
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Optional, Tuple

from fastapi_jwt_auth import AuthJWT
from fastapi_sqlalchemy import db
from marshmallow_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemyAutoSchema
from sqlalchemy import BigInteger, Column, DateTime, ForeignKey, Integer, String
from sqlalchemy.dialects.mysql import TINYINT
from sqlalchemy.orm import relationship

from .. import secure
from ..middlewares.database import Base


class _User(Base):
    """ "Model for User.
    Example:
        >>> User(
            accountNonLocked=True,
            account_type=1,
            creation_date=datetime.now(),
            enabled=True,
            first_name="John",
            last_name="Doe",
            locale="en_US",
            password_hash="password",
            password_changed_date=datetime.now(),
            password_expiration_interval=-1,
            password_change_needed=False,
            payment_method="Internal",
            added_companies_count=0,
            added_helpers_count=0,
            subscription_companies_count=0,
            subscription_expiration_date=datetime.now(),
            subscription_helpers_count=0,
            subscription_plan_name="Free",
            subscription_notes="",
            subscription_plan_code="",
            subscription_status=False,
            username="johndoe@domain.com",
            parent_id=0,
        )
    Args:
        Base (sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.DeclarativeMeta): Base model.
    Base Attributes:
        __tablename__ (str): Name of the table.
        __table_args__ (tuple): Tuple of arguments for the table.
        query (sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query): Query object.
    Attributes:
        id (int): Primary key.
        accountNonLocked (bool): Account is locked or not.
        account_type (int): Account type.
        creation_date (datetime): Creation date.
        enabled (bool): Account is enabled or not.
        first_name (str): First name.
        last_name (str): Last name.
        locale (str): Locale.
        password_hash (str): Password hash.
        password_changed_date (datetime): Password changed date.
        password_expiration_interval (int): Password expiration interval.
        password_change_needed (bool): Password change needed or not.
        payment_method (str): Payment method.
        added_companies_count (int): Added companies count.
        added_helpers_count (int): Added helpers count.
        subscription_companies_count (int): Subscription companies count.
        subscription_expiration_date (datetime): Subscription expiration date.
        subscription_helpers_count (int): Subscription helpers count.
        subscription_plan_name (str): Subscription plan name.
        subscription_notes (str): Subscription notes.
        subscription_plan_code (str): Subscription plan code.
        subscription_status (bool): Subscription status.
        username (str): Username.
        parent_id (int): Parent id.
        parent (sqlalchemy.orm.relationships.RelationshipProperty): Parent relationship to itself.
        password_hash (property): Password hash property.
        password_hash (setter): Password hash setter.
        check_password (method): Check password method.
        encode_auth_token (method): Encode auth token method.
        decode_auth_token (method): Decode auth token method.
    """

    __tablename__ = "user"

    id = Column(BigInteger, primary_key=True, autoincrement=True, nullable=False)
    accountNonLocked = Column(TINYINT(1), nullable=False, default=1)
    account_type = Column(String(32), nullable=False, default="Owner")
    creation_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=False, default=datetime.utcnow())
    enabled = Column(TINYINT(1), nullable=True, default=0)
    first_name = Column(String(128), nullable=False)
    last_name = Column(String(128), nullable=False)
    locale = Column(String(255), nullable=True, default="en_US")
    password = Column(String(255), nullable=False, default=None)
    password_changed_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=True, default=None)
    password_expiration_interval = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=-1)
    password_change_needed = Column(
        TINYINT(1),
        nullable=False,
        default=0,
    )
    # token = Column(String(255), nullable=True, default=None)
    # token_expiration = Column(DateTime, nullable=True, default=None)
    payment_method = Column(String(128), nullable=False, default="Internal")
    # recurly_login_token = Column(String(128), nullable=False, default=None)
    added_companies_count = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0)
    added_helpers_count = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0)
    subscription_companies_count = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0)
    subscription_expiration_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=True, default=None)
    subscription_helpers_count = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0)
    subscription_plan_name = Column(String(128), nullable=True, default=None)
    subscription_notes = Column(String(2048), nullable=True, default=None)
    subscription_plan_code = Column(String(128), nullable=True)
    subscription_status = Column(Integer, nullable=False, default=0)
    username = Column(String(255), nullable=True, unique=True, default=None)
    parent_id = Column(
        BigInteger, ForeignKey("user.id"), nullable=True, default=None, index=True
    )

    parent = relationship("_User", remote_side=[id])

    @property
    def password_hash(self) -> None:
        """Raise error when trying to read password"""
        raise AttributeError("password: write-only field")

    @password_hash.setter
    def password_hash(self, password: str) -> None:
        """Set password hash.
        Args:
            password (str): Password.
        """
        self.password = secure.generate_password_hash(password).decode("utf-8")

    def check_password(self, password: str) -> bool:
        """Check password.
        Args:
            password (str): password to check
        Returns:
            bool: True if password is correct, False otherwise
        """
        return secure.check_password_hash(self.password, password)  # type: ignore

    @staticmethod
    def encode_auth_token(
        _id: int,
    ) -> Tuple[str or None, str or None]:
        """Generate the auth token.
        Args:
            _id (int): User id.
        Returns:
            response (tuple): Tuple of tokens.
        """
        access_token = AuthJWT().create_access_token(
            subject=_id, expires_time=timedelta(minutes=30)
        )
        refresh_token = AuthJWT().create_refresh_token(
            subject=_id, expires_time=timedelta(minutes=90)
        )
        return access_token, refresh_token

    @staticmethod
    def decode_auth_token(_authorize: AuthJWT) -> str or None:
        """Decode the auth token.
        Args:
            _authorize (AuthJWT): AuthJWT object.
        Returns:
            response (User): The current user or None.
        """
        response = None
        try:
            response = (
                db.session.query(_User)
                .filter_by(id=_authorize.get_jwt_subject())
                .first()
            )
        except:
            print(
                "NoResultFound or MultipleResultsFound",
            )
            response = None
        return response


class _Schema(SQLAlchemyAutoSchema):
    """Class for schema.
    Example:
        >>> Schema().dump(model)->dict
        >>> Schema().load(model)
        >>> Schema(many=True).dump(model)->list
        >>> Schema(many=True).load(model)
    Args:
        SQLAlchemyAutoSchema (class): class for schema.
    Attributes:
        Meta (class): class for schema.
    """

    class Meta:
        """class to handle the metadata of the schema.
        Attributes:
            model (class): The model to use for the schema.
            load_instance (bool): Whether to load the instance.
            include_relationships (bool): Whether to include the relationships.
            include_fk (bool): Whether to include the foreign keys.
        """

        model = _User
        include_relationships = True
        load_instance = True
        include_fk = True


class _Read:
    """Class to handle read operations on the User model
    Example:
        >>> Read.all()
        >>> Read.by_id(id)
        >>> Read.by_company_id(company_id)
        >>> Read.by_parent_id(parent_id)
    Attributes:
        all (method): Return all records.
        by_id (method): Return a record by id.
        by_company_id (method): Return a record by company id.
        by_parent_id (method): Return a record by parent id.
    """

    @staticmethod
    async def all(
        to_list: Optional[bool] = False, exclude: Optional[list] = None
    ) -> _User or _Schema or None:
        """
        This method select all records from the database
        Args:
            to_list (bool, optional): If the result should be a list.
            exclude (list, optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (model|dict|None): list of records
        """
        try:
            response = db.session.query(_User).all()
            if to_list:
                response = _Schema(many=True).dump(response)
            if exclude is not None:
                response = _Schema(many=True, exclude=exclude).dump(response)
            return response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            return None

    @staticmethod
    async def by_id(
        _id: int, to_dict: Optional[bool] = False, exclude: Optional[list] = None
    ) -> _User or _Schema or None:
        """This method select a record from the database by id
        Args:
            _id (int): id to work with in the database
            to_dict (bool, optional): If the result should be a dict.
            exclude (list, optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (model|dict|None): model instance
        """
        try:
            response = db.session.query(_User).get(_id)
            if to_dict:
                response = _Schema().dump(response)
            if exclude is not None:
                response = _Schema(exclude=exclude).dump(response)
            return response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            return None

    @staticmethod
    async def by_parent_id(
        parent_id: int, to_list: Optional[bool] = False, exclude: Optional[list] = None
    ) -> _User or _Schema or None:
        """
        This method select all records from the database
        Args:
            to_list (bool, optional): If the result should be a list.
            exclude (list, optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (model|dict|None): list of records
        """
        try:
            response = db.session.query(_User).filter_by(parent_id=parent_id).all()
            if to_list:
                response = _Schema(many=True, exclude=["password"]).dump(response)
            if exclude is not None:
                response = _Schema(many=True, exclude=exclude).dump(response)
            return response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            return None

    @staticmethod
    async def by_username(
        username: str, to_dict: Optional[bool] = False, exception: Optional[list] = None
    ) -> _User or _Schema or None:
        """This method select a record from the database by username
        Args:
            username (str): id to work with in the database
            to_list (bool,optional): If the result should be a list.
            exception (list,optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (model|dict|None): model instance
        """
        try:
            response = (
                db.session.query(_User).filter_by(username=username).one_or_none()
            )
            if to_dict:
                response = _Schema(exclude=["password"]).dump(response)
            if exception is not None:
                response = _Schema(exclude=exception).dump(response)
            return response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            return None



[docs]class User:
    """class User to handle model operations.
    Example:
        >>> User.create(data)->model
        >>> User.create(data, to_dict=True)->dict
        >>> User.update(id, data)->Tuple[bool, model]
        >>> User.update(id, data, to_dict=True)->Tuple[bool,dict]
        >>> User.delete(id)->Tuple[bool, model]
        >>> User.delete(id, to_dict=True)->Tuple[bool, dict]
        >>> User.to_dict(model)->dict
        >>> User.to_list(model)->list

    Attributes:
        Table (class): The model class.
        Schema (class): The schema class.
        Read (class): The read class.
        create (method): The create method.
        update (method): The update method.
        delete (method): The delete method.
        to_dict (method): The to_dict method.
        to_list (method): The to_list method.
    """

    Table = _User
    Schema = _Schema
    read = _Read()


[docs]    @staticmethod
    async def create(
        username: str,
        first_name: str,
        last_name: str,
        password: str,
        to_dict: Optional[bool] = False,
        exclude: Optional[list] = None,
    ) -> Tuple[bool, _User or _Schema or None]:
        """
        This method creates a new record in the database with the current model.
        Receive a dict with the data to create the record and return a tuple.\n
        Args:
            username (str): username
            first_name (str): first name of the user
            last_name (str): last name of the user
            password (str): password of the user
            to_dict (bool,optional): if True, return a dict, else return a model instance.
            exclude (list,optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (bool): True if success, False if not
            reponse_data (model): data to return
        """
        try:
            new = _User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                password_hash=password,
                username=username,
            )
            db.session.add(new)
            db.session.commit()
            db.session.refresh(new)
            response = new
            if to_dict:
                response = _Schema(exclude=["password"]).dump(new)
            if exclude is not None:
                if "password" not in exclude:
                    exclude.append("password")
                response = _Schema(exclude=exclude).dump(new)
            return True, response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            db.session.rollback()
            db.session.flush()
            return False, None



[docs]    @staticmethod
    async def update(
        _id: int,
        data: dict,
        to_dict: Optional[bool] = False,
        exclude: Optional[list] = None,
    ) -> Tuple[bool, _User or _Schema or None]:
        """This method updates the current model in the database
        Receive a id and a dict with the data to update\
in a loop check the items in the dict and update the record\
and return a tuple with the results
        Args:
            _id (int): id to work with in the database
            data (dict): data to work with
            to_dict (bool, optional): if True, return a dict, else return a model instance
            exclude (list, optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (bool): True if success, False if not
            response_data (model): data to return
        """
        current_entity = db.session.query(_User).get(_id)
        if current_entity is None:
            return False, None
        try:
            for key, item in data.items():
                setattr(current_entity, key, item)
            db.session.merge(current_entity)
            db.session.commit()
            response = current_entity
            if to_dict:
                response = _Schema().dump(current_entity)
            if exclude is not None:
                response = _Schema(exclude=exclude).dump(response)
            return True, response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            db.session.rollback()
            db.session.flush()
            return False, None



[docs]    @staticmethod
    async def delete(
        _id: int, to_dict: Optional[bool] = False, exclude: Optional[list] = None
    ) -> Tuple[bool, _User or _Schema or None]:
        """
        This method deletes a record from the database.
        Receive a id and return a tuple with the results.
        Args:
            _id (int): id to work with in the database
            to_dict (bool,optional): if True, return a dict, else return a model instance
            exclude (list, optional): List of columns to exclude.
        Returns:
            response (bool): True if success, False if not
            response_data (model): data to return
        """
        current_entity = db.session.query(_User).get(_id)
        if current_entity is None:
            return False, None
        try:
            db.session.delete(current_entity)
            db.session.commit()
            response = current_entity
            if to_dict:
                response = _Schema().dump(current_entity)
            if exclude is not None:
                response = _Schema(exclude=exclude).dump(response)
            return True, response
        except (RuntimeError, TypeError, NameError):
            print(RuntimeError)
            db.session.rollback()
            db.session.flush()
            return False, None



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def to_dict(entity: _User, exclude: Optional[list] = None) -> _Schema:
        """Pass a model instance to a dict
        Args:
            entity (model instance): data to work with
            exclude (list): list of fields to exclude
        Returns:
            response (dict): dict with data
        """
        if exclude is not None:
            _Schema(exclude=exclude).dump(entity)
        return _Schema().dump(entity)



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def to_list(entities: _User, exclude: Optional[list] = None) -> list:
        """Pass a model instance to a dict
        Args:
            entities (model): data to work with

        Returns:
            response (list): list with data
        """
        if exclude is not None:
            return _Schema(many=True, exclude=exclude).dump(entities)
        return _Schema(many=True).dump(entities)
